name: Monitoring
description: System monitoring and resource tracking commands

commands.name: CPU Usage
commands.description: Estimates total CPU usage as percentage of performance cores using 'ps' and 'system_profiler'. No external dependencies.
commands.monitor: ps -A -o %cpu | awk -v cores=$(system_profiler SPHardwareDataType | awk -F'[()]' '/Total Number of Cores:/ {match($2, /[0-9]+ performance/); print substr($2, RSTART, RLENGTH-12)}') '{s+=$1} END {printf "%.1f%%\n", s/cores}'

commands.name: Memory Usage
commands.description: Displays current memory usage in GB. Uses 'vm_stat' and 'sysctl' commands to show physical memory statistics. No additional dependencies required.
commands.monitor: echo "$(vm_stat | awk '/Pages active/ {a=$3} /Pages inactive/ {i=$3} /Pages speculative/ {s=$3} /Pages wired down/ {w=$4} END {printf "%.1f", (a+i+s+w)*4096/1073741824}') GB / $(sysctl -n hw.memsize | awk '{printf "%.1f", $1/1073741824}') GB"

commands.name: Disk Usage
commands.description: Shows disk usage percentage for the root filesystem. Uses 'df' command to display filesystem disk space usage. No additional dependencies required.

commands.name: Battery Level
commands.description: Displays current battery level percentage. Uses 'pmset' command to show power management information. Works on laptops with battery. No additional dependencies required.

commands.name: Uptime
commands.description: Shows system uptime in hours. Uses 'uptime' command to display how long the system has been running. No additional dependencies required.
commands.monitor: uptime | awk '{print $3}' | sed 's/,//' | awk -F: '{if(NF==2) print $1/24; else print $1}' | awk '{printf "%.1fh", $1}'

commands.name: Load Average
commands.description: Shows system load average. Uses 'uptime' command to display the average system load over time. No additional dependencies required.

commands.name: Active Processes
commands.description: Shows the number of active processes. Uses 'ps aux' command to list all running processes and counts them. No additional dependencies required.

commands.name: Docker Containers
commands.description: Shows the number of running Docker containers. Uses 'docker ps' command to list active containers. Requires Docker to be installed and running.

commands.name: Git Status
commands.description: Shows the number of modified files in current Git repository. Uses 'git status --porcelain' to count uncommitted changes. Requires Git to be installed.

commands.name: NPM Packages
commands.description: Shows the number of installed NPM packages in current project. Uses 'npm list' to count direct dependencies. Requires Node.js and NPM to be installed.

commands.name: Node Version
commands.description: Shows current Node.js version. Uses 'node --version' command to display the installed Node.js version. Requires Node.js to be installed.

commands.name: Python Version
commands.description: Shows current Python version. Uses 'python3 --version' command to display the installed Python version. Requires Python 3 to be installed.

commands.name: Ruby Version
commands.description: Shows current Ruby version. Uses 'ruby --version' command to display the installed Ruby version. Requires Ruby to be installed.

commands.name: Go Version
commands.description: Shows current Go version. Uses 'go version' command to display the installed Go version. Requires Go to be installed.

commands.name: Rust Version
commands.description: Shows current Rust version. Uses 'rustc --version' command to display the installed Rust compiler version. Requires Rust to be installed.

commands.name: Docker Version
commands.description: Shows current Docker version. Uses 'docker --version' command to display the installed Docker version. Requires Docker to be installed.

commands.name: Kubectl Version
commands.description: Shows the installed version of kubectl (Kubernetes CLI). Uses 'kubectl version --client --short' to display the client version. Requires kubectl to be installed. Install: https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/tools/

commands.name: Terraform Version
commands.description: Shows the installed version of Terraform. Uses 'terraform --version' to display the version. Requires Terraform to be installed. Install: https://developer.hashicorp.com/terraform/downloads

commands.name: Network Bandwidth Usage
commands.description: Shows current network bandwidth usage (bytes in/out per second). Uses 'netstat' and 'awk'. No additional dependencies required.
commands.monitor: netstat -ib | awk 'NR>1 {in+=$7; out+=$10} END {print "In: " in/1024/1024 " MB, Out: " out/1024/1024 " MB"}'

commands.name: Top Memory Process
commands.description: Shows the process using the most memory. Uses 'ps' and 'head'. No additional dependencies required.
commands.monitor: ps aux | sort -nrk 4,4 | head -2 | tail -1 | awk '{print $11}'

commands.name: System Temperature (sensors)
commands.description: Shows system temperature using 'sensors' (Linux, requires lm-sensors).

commands.name: Ping Google
commands.description: Shows average ping to google.com. Uses 'ping' command. No additional dependencies required.

commands.name: Logged-in Users
commands.description: Shows the number of users currently logged in. Uses 'who' command. No additional dependencies required.

commands.name: Swap Usage
commands.description: Shows current swap usage. Uses 'sysctl' and 'vm_stat' (macOS) or 'free' (Linux). No additional dependencies required.

commands.name: File Descriptor Usage
commands.description: Shows the number of open file descriptors. Uses 'lsof'. No additional dependencies required.

commands.name: Bluetooth Device Battery (system_profiler)
commands.description: Shows battery level of connected Bluetooth devices using 'system_profiler' (macOS only).

commands.name: Bluetooth Device Battery (ioreg)
commands.description: Shows battery level and product name of connected Bluetooth devices using 'ioreg' (macOS only).

commands.name: Magic Mouse Battery (macOS)
commands.description: Shows battery percent for Magic Mouse (macOS only).
commands.monitor: ioreg -c AppleDeviceManagementHIDEventService | awk '/"Product" =/ {prod=$3; for(i=4;i<=NF;i++) prod=prod" "$i} /"BatteryPercent" =/ {gsub(/"/, "", prod); if (prod ~ /Magic Mouse/) print $3 "%"}'

commands.name: AirPods Battery (macOS)
commands.description: Shows battery percent for AirPods (macOS only).
commands.monitor: ioreg -c AppleDeviceManagementHIDEventService | awk '/"Product" =/ {prod=$3; for(i=4;i<=NF;i++) prod=prod" "$i} /"BatteryPercent" =/ {gsub(/"/, "", prod); if (prod ~ /AirPods/) print $3 "%"}'
